oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Jena School
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Edwin Best
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Jena School; Greenback (Tenn.);
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Photographs of people at what is possibly Jena School. According to Elizabeth Timmons, (Tizzy's Corner, The Daily Times, October 30, 1983, printed in The Heritage of Greenback, Tennessee: An Historical Scrapbook), Jena School was a two-room school with two coal stoves for heat, a big lunch room and a room for coats. Students in grade one through eight attended six months each year. Its predecessor was the Pine Grove School at the present site of Pine Grove Cemetery.
